author: Daniel Wiessner
title: 2nd Circuit to hear latest duel in long-running Sterling Jewelers sex bias case
text:
A U.S. appeals court in Manhattan on Monday will consider whether 60,000 women were properly added to a class arbitration accusing Sterling Jewelers Inc of discriminating against them in pay and promotions even though they did not opt in to the class.
Joseph Sellers of Cohen Milstein Sellers & Toll will ask a three-judge panel of the 2nd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals to restore an arbitratorâ€™s ruling that said the women could be included in a certified class, which a federal judge reversed in January. Ohio-based Sterling is represented by Gerald Maatman of Seyfarth Shaw.
